applicability_reasoning: This regulation does not apply to the provided Pension Life Cover Scheme Rules document for several reasons: 1) The regulation specifically pertains to insurance quotations provided on digital platforms and subsequent telephone follow-ups, while this document is a comprehensive scheme rules document for an executive pension life cover product. 2) The document outlines the formal rules, definitions, and operational procedures of a pension scheme rather than dealing with quotation or sales processes. 3) The document is focused on trustee duties, scheme benefits, and administrative procedures rather than consumer communication channels or marketing practices. 4) While the document does include contact information for AIB life, it does not discuss quotation processes or digital platform interactions that would fall under the scope of Regulation 339. The regulation is specifically about obtaining consent for follow-up calls after digital quotations, which is not relevant to the content or purpose of these scheme rules.
regulation_title: Consent to be obtained for follow up telephone communication in respect of an insurance quotation provided on a digital platform
regulation_text: 339. (1) Notwithstanding Regulations 109 and 110, where a consumer requests an insurance quotation from an insurance undertaking or insurance intermediary on a digital platform or via a website, the insurance undertaking or insurance intermediary shall not make follow up oral communication by means of telephone call for the purposes of discussing the insurance quotation unless the consumer has provided his or her consent to it doing so. (2) Paragraph (1) is subject to the further condition that the making of the follow up telephone call is not prohibited under any other applicable law. Chapter 7 Knowing the consumer and suitability - insurance specific provisions
source_name: CENTRAL BANK (SUPERVISION AND ENFORCEMENT) ACT 2013 (SECTION 48) (CONSUMER PROTECTION) REGULATIONS 2025
